snippet: Some called for a more lasting solution amid charges that changes by the Obama administration had hindered government inspectors.
abstract: Justice Dept takes steps to restore some government watchdog agencies' access to sensitive internal records, responding to inspector generals' complaints that limits imposed by Obama administration have hampered their investigations; officials demand that Congress enact permanent, wider fix, to ensure availability of grand jury documents, wiretapping records and other materials.
lead_paragraph: Some called for a more lasting solution amid charges that changes by the Obama administration had hindered government inspectors.

headline.main: Justice Dept. Takes Steps to Restore Watchdogs’ Access to Records
headline.print_headline: Steps Taken to Restore Watchdogs’ Access to Records

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Wiretapping and Other Eavesdropping Devices and Methods
